availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Armstead M. Feland (Lincoln County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Lincoln County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Cooper Feland. Father of William Feland, Albert Feland, and Faris Feland, Farmer in Lincoln County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Lincoln County in 1850. Farmer in Lincoln County in 1860. Owned thirteen enslaved persons in Lincoln County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, District 2, p. 281A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, District 2, p. 243.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, p. 34.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, p. 343B.
"Armstead Milner Feland (1820-1906)," Find A Grave, Memorial 41542996, accessed June 23, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/41542996.
"Locals," Interior Journal (Stanford, Kentucky), June 26, 1906, p. 3.
